top_contributing_features.pd_indication: Reduced HNR indicates increased vocal noise and hoarseness
Abnormal DFA indicates disrupted vocal control dynamics

clinical_prompt:
Analyze the following Parkinson's Disease voice biomarker assessment:

PATIENT ID: patient_new_patient
PREDICTION: Healthy
CONFIDENCE: 90.2%

TOP CONTRIBUTING FEATURES:

1. Harmonics-to-Noise Ratio (HNR)
   Patient Value: 0.9331
   Normal Range: >13 dB
   SHAP Impact: -0.1194 (↓ decreases PD probability)
   Clinical Significance: Reduced HNR indicates increased vocal noise and hoarseness

2. D2 (D2)
   Patient Value: -1.0659
   Normal Range: Not specified
   SHAP Impact: -0.1032 (↓ decreases PD probability)
   Clinical Significance: Clinical interpretation not available

3. Detrended Fluctuation Analysis (DFA)
   Patient Value: 0.7819
   Normal Range: 0.6-0.7
   SHAP Impact: -0.0564 (↓ decreases PD probability)
   Clinical Significance: Abnormal DFA indicates disrupted vocal control dynamics

4. Fundamental Frequency (MDVP:Fo(Hz))
   Patient Value: -0.9410
   Normal Range: 85-180 Hz (male), 165-255 Hz (female)
   SHAP Impact: -0.0525 (↓ decreases PD probability)
   Clinical Significance: Reduced variability indicates vocal rigidity

5. spread2 (spread2)
   Patient Value: -0.3435
   Normal Range: Not specified
   SHAP Impact: -0.0477 (↓ decreases PD probability)
   Clinical Significance: Clinical interpretation not available

TASK: Based on the SHAP analysis above, provide a clinical interpretation that:
1. Summarizes the key acoustic findings in 2-3 sentences
2. Explains what the top features indicate about vocal function
3. Relates findings to PD motor symptoms (rigidity, bradykinesia, tremor)
4. Assesses the reliability of this prediction based on feature patterns

Keep the explanation concise and accessible to healthcare providers.
